      Based on a true story, this is the love affair between a       
      Lithuanian genius and the woman and the country he adored.     
      Mikalojus Konstantinas Ciurlionis was born into a Lithuanian   
      peasant family in 1875. Despite his lowly origins he soon      
      revealed himself to be a child prodigy able to both paint      
      and compose music of startling and often frightening           
      intensity. Soon after he was struck down by a mysterious       
      mental illness, which would plague him for the rest of his     
      life. During his short lifetime, Ciurlionis produced over      
      300 paintings and 300 musical compositions. Supporting him     
      throughout his short and painful life was his beloved wife,    
      Sofija Kymantaite, a journalist and political activist.
